How to Install quagga-ripngd on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • quagga-ripngd

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install quagga-ripngd on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing quagga-ripngd on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall quagga-ripngd in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install quagga-ripngd, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install quagga-ripngd Using apt

To install quagga-ripngd in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install quagga-ripngd using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install quagga-ripngd

The installation of quagga-ripngd might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install quagga-ripngd Using apt-get

To install quagga-ripngd using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install quagga-ripngd.

sudo apt-get -y install quagga-ripngd

Install quagga-ripngd Using Synaptic

To install quagga-ripngd using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install quagga-ripngd on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for quagga-ripngd. This will display the quagga-ripngd package in the package window, now to install quagga-ripngd, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the quagga-ripngd package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of quagga-ripngd.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install quagga-ripngd Using aptitude

To install quagga-ripngd on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of quagga-ripngd.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install quagga-ripngd using the command aptitude install quagga-ripngd.

sudo aptitude -y install quagga-ripngd

How to Upgrade quagga-ripngd on debian

If you want to upgrade the quagga-ripngd package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade quagga-ripngd using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade quagga-ripngd to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade quagga-ripngd.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade quagga-ripngd sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade quagga-ripngd

Upgrade quagga-ripngd using Aptitude

To upgrade quagga-ripngd using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade quagga-ripngd.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade quagga-ripngd

Upgrade quagga-ripngd using Synaptic

To upgrade quagga-ripngd using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for quagga-ripngd, now right-click quagga-ripngd, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade quagga-ripngd just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall quagga-ripngd on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall quagga-ripngd from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just quagga-ripngd, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove quagga-ripngd

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of quagga-ripngd

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of quagga-ripngd you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge quagga-ripngd

Remove quagga-ripngd using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall quagga-ripngd using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for quagga-ripngd, right-click the quagga-ripngd package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall quagga-ripngd click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install quagga-ripngd on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade quagga-ripngd using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of quagga-ripngd then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
